alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 5:12AM EST until December 28 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey, including the following counties, Burlington, Camden, Gloucester, Hunterdon, Mercer, Morris, Salem, Somerset and Warren and southeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Bucks, Delaware, Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated earlier heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell overnight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Trenton, Camden, Wilmington, Somerville, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Bensalem, Evesham, Bridgewater, Mount Laurel and Ewing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
